meanings.definition: To fill or pack too full with an excessive amount of something.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally overstuffing my suitcase with clothes for the trip.
meanings.sent2: The chef warned against overstuffing the burritos to avoid them from bursting.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel kept overstuffing its cheeks with nuts, making it look like a chipmunk.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like it was overstuffing with joy when she saw her family after a long time.
meanings.sent5: The balloon popped due to overstuffing it with too much air.

meanings.definition: The act of filling or packing something too full with an excessive amount of something.
meanings.sent1: Overstuffing of the storage unit led to items falling out whenever the door was opened.
meanings.sent2: The overstuffing of the sandwich made it impossible to take a bite without the fillings spilling out.
meanings.sent3: The overstuffing of the gift bag made it challenging for the recipient to close it properly.
meanings.sent4: The overstuffing of emotions during the movie made her tear up unexpectedly.
meanings.sent5: The overstuffing of the drawer caused it to get stuck every time it was opened.
